page.title: 02The Enterprise Zone, Corby
page.content: With the closure of the steelworks Corby was designated as the first Enterprise zone in the country on 22nd June, 1981, so that new industries could be attracted to supply jobs for the unemployed. The zone provides exemptions from land rates, 100% income tax allowances on capital expenditure on buildings, no industrial development certificates and simplified planning procedures in an effort to pursue industrial regeneration. 280 acres of land were designated and are divided into three zones, Earlstrees,109acres, Weldon South 38.67 acres and Weldon North, 132 acres. All three zones are now completely filled with light industrial factories providing thousands of new jobs in the area
